DataElement.preferredName: Oral Verrucous Lesion Disease Prior Biopsy Performed Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator that asks whether oral warts (verrucous lesions) were previously biopsied.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Oral Verrucous Lesion Disease Prior Biopsy Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to the prior (earlier in time or order) biopsy (removal and pathologic examination of specimens in the form of small pieces of tissue from the living body) of an oral (of or relating to or affecting the mouth) wart (verrucous lesion; a raised growth on the surface of the skin or other organ).

ObjectClass.preferredName: Oral Verrucous Lesion Diseases and Disorders
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Oral; of, or relating to, or affecting, or for use in the mouth.:A raised growth on the surface of the skin or other organ.:A definite pathologic process with a characteristic set of signs and symptoms. It may affect the whole body or any of its parts, and its etiology, pathology, and prognosis may be known or unknown.

Concepts.definition: Of, or relating to, or affecting, or for use in the mouth.
A papillomavirus related epithelial overgrowth. It can be located anywhere on the body though when it involves the perineal region it is generally referred to as condyloma acuminatum.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Property.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order.:Removal and pathologic examination of specimens in the form of small pieces of tissue from the living body.:Performed; carried out.

Concepts.definition: The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
